newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India buys one Oct 0.25 diesel cargo from Vitol.
newsitem.headline: India buys one Oct 0.25 diesel cargo from Vitol.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has awarded one 45,000-tonne 0.25 percent sulphur diesel cargo for October delivery, trading sources said on Monday.
IOC had tendered to buy two 45,000-tonne cargoes for delivery in October but due to lower demand awarded only one, a trader said.
Traders said IOC awarded the cargo for delivery on October 21-25 to Dutch trader, Vitol, at $2.50 per barrel above the published MidEast quotes cost-and-freight (c-and-f) West Coast India.
IOC did not award the cargo it had tendered to buy for arrival on October 11-15, traders said.

IOC bought two cargos in September of similar grade diesel, one from a U.S. major at the mean of MidEast quotes plus $2.88 c-and-f Kandla and the second from a Mideast state oil producer at 90 cents premium to Mideast quotes fob Kuwait.
